title: Ghanaian Travel & Tour Operators Tour Nairobi
text:
30 September 2015 14:07 CET Ghanaian Travel & Tour Operators Tour Nairobi By Daily Guide 
Some three Kenya Airways cabin crew displaying new menu 
Kenya Airways (KQ) recently sponsored some travel and tour agencies operating in Ghana on a special tour of some of the best tourist attractions in Nairobi and Mombasa. 
Some Ghanaian media personnel, who also embarked on the trip, were exposed to the ticketing agencies, tour agencies and numerous tourism packages in Kenya so they could better market them to clients. 
Over the past couple of years, Kenya Airways has expanded its operations on continent and beyond, and its training school in Nairobi is rated first in the sub-region by IATA. 
Anthony Safo, a corporate executive with Kenya Airways' Ghana office, told journalists that the airline has made a lot of investment, adding that Kenya has also built a new airport, probably second best in Africa. 
'And so we decided to go with our friends to Kenya and show them the tourism attractions that exist in Kenya and also the new facilities that Kenya Airways has so they could better sell these to clients. Now they have experienced the Mara, wonder Mombasa, and the other places on our package. Now we would not push them to sell the destinations to their clients. 
Plans for Ghanaian airline market He said Kenya Airways has always had a wonderful relationship with Ghana. 
'We have special routes just for traders. Also we are trying to improve and expand more trader routes. We are also trying as much as possible to engage the corporates even more with the our new wonderful project - KQ Hot Deals - where we are encouraging more and more people especially our corporate clientele to book earlier so they can save on costs. That means that they can now expand their budget and make much more profits for themselves.' 
The African vision Tourism is one of the important sectors of Kenya's economy and Kenya Airways (KQ), which is the national carrier, is to connect people from all over the world to Nairobi and other parts of Africa. 
'However, we are not only promoting destination Kenya but also destination Africa. KQ's key role is to continue giving reliable services so it can bring people from all over the world to experience the rich heritage of Africa.' 
New routes Kenya Airways just started Hanoi from Nairobi but also connects from all other places. 
'Kenya is the home of African tourism. Beyond Kenya too, we have holiday packages to Zanzibar, Seychelles, Mauritius and so many African countries. Additionally, for those who would want to go outside Africa, we have Dubai, Hanoi and etc. 
Kenya Airways is in partnership with the Kenya Tourist Board and Destination Kenya's marketing body called 'Magical' Kenya. 'A few weeks back, we brought Magical Kenya and KTB to Ghana and linked them to the Ghana Tourist Board so they can work together. If tourist authorities in the countries should promote their own destinations, we will partner them to further push it.' 
Founded in January 1977, the airline, whose main hub is the Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, has 44 aircraft plus two which are on order. 
By Samuel Boadi, Courtesy of Kenya Airways
